entries.title: Busting a myth: Saturn V rocket wasn’t loud enough to melt concrete
entries.description: It also wasn't loud enough to ignite grass or hair, or "blast rainbows from the sky."

entries.title: TV Technica 2022:  These were our favorite shows and binges of the year
entries.description: Streamers dominated original programming in 2022, but the 2023 forecast is cloudy.

entries.title: Could getting rid of old cells turn back the clock on aging?
entries.description: Researchers are investigating medicines that selectively kill decrepit cells.

entries.title: Mastodon—and the pros and cons of moving beyond Big Tech gatekeepers
entries.description: Standards-based interoperability makes a comeback, sort of.

entries.title: Ars Technica’s favorite films in 2022
entries.description: This year we gingerly ventured back into theaters, but streaming is still in the game

entries.title: 2022’s US climate disasters, from storms and floods to heat waves and droughts
entries.description: Way too much rainfall in some places, not nearly enough in others.
